etymology.description: pictogram: bones; original form of 骨.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts exposed bones/jaw, reflecting a skeletal shape. Served historically as the graph for “bone” and survives as a top component in characters like 骨 and 咼 (the latter distinguishing itself by adding 口), with related forms seen in 呙 and the variant 另.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址里发现了几片冎(考古學家在遺址裡發現了幾片冎)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔxuéjiā zài yízhǐ lǐ fāxiànle jǐ piàn guǎ.
examples.english: Archaeologists found several jawbone fragments at the site.

examples.chinese: 河岸上出现了冎(河岸上出現了冎)。
examples.english: Bare bones appeared on the riverbank.

examples.chinese: 画中可见野兽的冎(畫中可見野獸的冎)。
examples.pinyin: Huà zhōng kějiàn yěshòu de guǎ.
examples.english: The painting shows a beast’s jawbone.
